uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class ShapeLayer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.SimpleLayer
        |
        +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.ShapeLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Layer
Direct Known Subclasses:
CircleLayer, PointLayer, PolygonLayer
public abstract class ShapeLayer
extends SimpleLayer
implements Layer

Shape layer is holds all of the common code used by layers that contain GeoShape features Much of the code in this class used to be duplicated multiple times by a number of classes

Since:
0.7.0
Author:
James Macgill

Method Detail

addGeoShape

protected void addGeoShape(GeoShape shape)
Adds the specified shape to the list of features in this layer Each layer type should implement a specific version of this for their own type
Parameters:
shape - The GeoShape to add to the layer

addGeoShape

protected void addGeoShape(GeoShape shape,
                           boolean keepQuiet)
Adds the specified shape to the list of features in this layer Each layer type should implement a specific version of this for their own type
Parameters:
shape - The GeoShape to add to the layer
keepQuiet - Tell the method not to fire a LayerChangedEvent. this more or less implies that you will to this yourselve.

getID

public int getID(GeoPoint p)
Find the feature that contains this point. Note This method will return the first feature found to contain the point only, even if multiple, overlapping features, contain the same point.
Specified by:
getID in interface Layer
Parameters:
point - The GeoPoint to test each feature against.
Returns:
int The ID of the first feature to contain this point, -1 if no feature was found

getID

public int getID(double x,
                 double y)
Find the feature that contains this point. Note This method will return the first feature found to contain the point only, even if multiple, overlapping features, contain the same point.
Specified by:
getID in interface Layer
Parameters:
x - The x ordinate to test each feature against.
y - The y ordinate to test each feature against.
Returns:
int The ID of the first feature to contain this point, -1 if no feature was found

getIDs

public int[] getIDs(GeoRectangle box,
                    int mode)
Find the IDs features that are contained by, or intersect (mode dependent) the given rectangle
Specified by:
getIDs in interface Layer
Overrides:
getIDs in class SimpleLayer
Parameters:
box - The GeoRectangle to test each feature against
mode - Selects between CONTAINS and INTERSECTS
Returns:
int The IDs of the features to contain this point, zero length if no feature was found

setScaleBuffer

public void setScaleBuffer(boolean flag)
Switches the 'scaled version' buffer on and off Use this if the map will be redrawn without changing scale for some reason Typical applications involve animation of the layers shading.

isScaleBuffer

public boolean isScaleBuffer()
Find out if the scaleBuffer flag is switched on As not all layers suport scaleBuffering a result of true is not always a guarante that it will be used.
Returns:
boolean true if the scaleBuffer option is swiched on

isScaleBufferImplemented

public boolean isScaleBufferImplemented()
Use to determine if scale buffering is available for this layer. Layers that use this feature should overide this mehtod.
Returns:
boolean true if scale buffering can be used.
